archetype_name: Family Light & Fresh: Japanese and Vietnamese Weeknights
name: Lime-Basil Chicken Rice Bowls (No Soy)
description: Light chicken and crisp vegetables over jasmine rice, finished with fresh lime and herbs. Clean, bright flavors without soy or fish sauce.
prep_steps: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Trim excess fat from 600 g chicken thighs; slice into thin strips.
Slice 1 bell pepper into thin strips.
Peel and thinly slice 2 medium carrots.
Rinse and chop 2 small heads bok choy (separate stems and leaves).
Slice 4 spring onions (whites and greens separated).
Halve 1 small cucumber lengthwise; thinly slice into half-moons for topping.
Roughly chop 1/2 cup basil, 1/4 cup mint, and 1/4 cup coriander.
Measure 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
cook_steps: Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice and 3 cups water to a pot. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce to low, and simmer 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest 5 minutes covered.
Microwave quick-soften carrots: In a microwave-safe bowl, add sliced carrots and 2 tbsp water. Cover and microwave 1 minute; drain.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high. Add 1 tbsp olive oil.
Stir-fry chicken: Add chicken, 1/2 tsp salt, and black pepper. Cook 4–5 minutes until just cooked through and lightly browned. Transfer to a plate.
Add remaining 1 tbsp olive oil to the skillet. Add garlic, spring onion whites, carrots, bell pepper, and bok choy stems. Stir-fry 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add bok choy leaves and spring onion greens. Return chicken to the pan. Toss 1 minute to wilt leaves.
Finish: Turn off heat. Add rice vinegar and juice of 1–2 limes to taste. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Fluff rice with a fork. Divide rice into 4 bowls. Top with chicken and vegetables.
Garnish with cucumber, basil, mint, and coriander. Serve with extra lime wedges if desired.
instructions: Rinse 2 cups jasmine rice until water runs clear.
Trim excess fat from 600 g chicken thighs; slice into thin strips.
Slice 1 bell pepper into thin strips.
Peel and thinly slice 2 medium carrots.
Rinse and chop 2 small heads bok choy (separate stems and leaves).
Slice 4 spring onions (whites and greens separated).
Halve 1 small cucumber lengthwise; thinly slice into half-moons for topping.
Mince 3 cloves garlic.
Roughly chop 1/2 cup basil, 1/4 cup mint, and 1/4 cup coriander.
Halve 2 limes for juicing.
Measure 2 tbsp rice vinegar, 2 tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp salt, and 1/2 tsp black pepper.
Cook rice: Add rinsed jasmine rice and 3 cups water to a pot. Bring to a boil, cover, reduce to low, and simmer 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest 5 minutes covered.
Microwave quick-soften carrots: In a microwave-safe bowl, add sliced carrots and 2 tbsp water. Cover and microwave 1 minute; drain.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high. Add 1 tbsp olive oil.
Stir-fry chicken: Add chicken, 1/2 tsp salt, and black pepper. Cook 4–5 minutes until just cooked through and lightly browned. Transfer to a plate.
Add remaining 1 tbsp olive oil to the skillet. Add garlic, spring onion whites, carrots, bell pepper, and bok choy stems. Stir-fry 2–3 minutes until crisp-tender.
Add bok choy leaves and spring onion greens. Return chicken to the pan. Toss 1 minute to wilt leaves.
Finish: Turn off heat. Add rice vinegar and juice of 1–2 limes to taste. Adjust salt and black pepper.
Fluff rice with a fork. Divide rice into 4 bowls. Top with chicken and vegetables.
Garnish with cucumber, basil, mint, and coriander. Serve with extra lime wedges if desired.
